data.title: Grand Duchess Olga Fjodoowna Romanov Rubies
data.meta_description: Imperial Ruby Wreath Tiara|Grand Duchess Olga Fjodoowna Romanov Rubies |Grand Duchess Maria Georgievna of Russia| Princess Maria of Greece and Denmark
data.text:
Imperial Ruby Wreath Tiara|Großfürstin Olga Fjodoowna Romanov Rubine |Grand Duchess Maria Georgievna of Russia| Princess Maria of Greece and Denmark

Großfürstin Maria Georgievna, trägt hier Olga Feodorowna's Blätter Kranz aus Diamanten, gefertigt von den fantastischen Rubinen von Großfürstin Olga, Ihrer Schwiegermutter.

Es muss sich um ein älteres Diadem handeln, denn es besteht aus diesen überaus großen und wellig 3-dimensional ausgearbeiteten Blätter und deshalb, wird es ein antikes Highlight sein.

Olga Konstantinowa's Tochter Marie Georgievna und damit die Enkelin von der Großfürstin Iossifowna, hat ihr zur Hochzeit im Jahr 1900, ein großes Rubinarmband geschenkt, evtl um dieses Rubin Set zu komplettieren.

Imperial Ruby Wreath Tiara|Grand Duchess Olga Fjodorowna Romanov Rubies |Grand Duchess Maria Georgievna of Russia| Princess Maria of Greece and Denmark

In the jewel album of Grand Duchess Olga Fjodorowna, Princess Cecilie of Baden is Nr 27, a sketch of a Diademe of diamond wreaths and rubies.

DIADEME couronne de feuilles - 21 Rubies, 34 Feuilles en diamantes, 10 chatons en diamants et 1carcasse en diamands - 23 235

In the year 1907 her daughter-in-law Grand Duchess Marie Georgievna of Russia, is wearing the ruby and diamond leaf wreath in the picture.

Grand Duchess Olga Fjodorowna died in the year 1891 and left her jewels to her daughter and the four sons.

Grand Duke Nicholas Mikhailovich of Russia 1859 - 1919, unmarried, he had an unhappy love and want to married his first cousin Victoria of Baden, he got probably his mother enormous diamond rivieres and imperial sapphire parure.

Grand Duchess Anastasia Mikhailovna of Russia 1860- 1922 married 1879, Grand Duke Friedrich Franz III of Mecklenburg-Schwerin, she got the ruby coronette, a ruby crown and diamonds, diamond chatons and probably part of the Imperial Romanov Sapphire Parure.

Grand Duke Michael Mikhailovich of Russia, married Sophie of Merenberg, he got a large sapphire necklace and sapphires jewels and probably from the 84 diamond chatons or the diamond riviere of 42 Chatons of 103 ct; Countess Sophie Merenberg, Torby owned a koskoshnik build of diamond chatons. Contracted an unequal marriage in San Remo on 26 February 1891. The marriage was not only morganatic but also illegal under the statute of the Imperial Family and caused a great scandal at the Russian court. Grand Duke Michael Mikhailovich was deprived of his military rank and of his position as adjutant at the Imperial Court and also forbidden to return to Russia for life. When Olga heard of her son's morganatic marriage, she was deeply wounded and fell ill and died short after this in April.

Grand Duke Georg Mihailovitch of Russia, got her 16 diamond buttons, ruby and diamond Sevigne fringe stomacher, ruby and diamond wreath leaves tiara, ruby and diamond necklace, from his mother.

Grand Duke Alexander Mikhailovich of Russia 1866-1933 - married in 1894 Grand Duchess Xenia Alexandrovna - he got a small pearl cluster brooch with the dangling pearl-drop, also the wonderful large stomacher in style of knots in diamonds and fine rubies, tassels of pearls and diamonds and probably the diamond fringe tiara from Grand Duchess Olga Feodorovna

Grand Duke Sergei Mikhailovich of Russia 1869 - 1918 - unmarried, was the mentor of the Ksessinska, nothing is know that he presented his mistress with imperial jewels from his mother.

Grand Duke Alexei Mikhailovich of Russia 1875-1895 died from typus, unmarried.

The diamond necklace could be the wedding present from her father-in-law, Grand Duke Mikhail Mikhailovich of Russia, it looks like the wedding gift to his grand daughter Cecilie of Mecklenburg, later Crown Princess of Prussia.
